bug.author: mohanramamurthy
bug.summary: Installing pandas-profiling on AIX - RuntimeError: unsupported platform:'aix6'
bug.description:
We tried to install pandas-Profiling to the AIX6 Server Machine. While installing it failed with following Error Message üëç RuntimeError: unsupported platform: 'aix6' The dependent package ‚ÄúPhik‚Äù installation is failing due to ‚Äúllvmlite‚Äù. Following is the Error Log : Collecting pandas-profiling Downloading "/tmp/pip-install-dhe_vuoj/llvmlite/ffi/build.py", line 164, in main raise RuntimeError("unsupported platform: %r" % (sys.platform,)) RuntimeError: unsupported platform: 'aix6' error: command '/usr/bin/python3' failed with exit status 1 <denchmark-code>---------------------------------------- </denchmark-code>
Please let us know how to fix this issue or is there anyway to bypass this issue to make pandas-profiling working in AIX Server. Thanks

comments.comment: As a quick fix you could download the package and remove the dependency from requirements.txt and setup.py. The package is only used to calculate the Phi_k correlation measure, which you can turn off via the configuration. In future versions, this package should be optional. You might also consider opening an issue at the llvmlite side. The error is thrown here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/numba/llvmlite/blob/master/ffi/build.py#L164>https://github.com/numba/llvmlite/blob/master/ffi/build.py#L164</denchmark-link> . I've never worked with AIX, but it is Unix based. I wouldn't find it unthinkable that the platform check is not complete and should detect AIX as Linux. I know too little of the combination, but it would seem something worthwhile trying.
